title: What is cloud infrastructure monitoring? - Quora

response.answer_text: Cloud monitoring is the process of evaluating, monitoring, and managing cloud-based services, applications, and infrastructure. Companies utilize various application monitoring tools to monitor cloud-based applications. Here’s a look at how it works and best practices for success.

With the age of distributed systems came a lot of awesome benefits like lower costs, faster services and access to infrastructure that was very hard to come by before (just look at FaaS). But just like with everything else, all this good came with the issue of having to keep an eye on them. Most often then not you’ll end up using multiple vendors, multiple products, and multiple services. This will make it really hard to fix bugs, track performance issues and this level of complexity will really take a toll on your systems overall observability. Cloud infrastructure monitoring is a process that makes sure an application both remains available and responds to user requests within an acceptable amount of time. More broadly speaking, cloud monitoring can also involve goals such as optimizing code or reducing infrastructure costs. Fortunately, there are solutions that will salve this very issue. Sematext.com is just one of many that can help you monitor your cloud infrastructure while having a very low footprint.
